Expectation1: Adhere to site protocols and work effectively as part of the team.
Situation1: The site-wide evacuation alarm has just sounded, and you must stop everything and proceed to the muster point immediately.
Expectation2: Show love and kindness to others, following the teachings of Jesus
Situation2: They offer small gestures of kindness in daily interactions
Story: The shrill site alarm jolted me from my work, echoing across the half-built structure. My foreman’s voice cut through the noise, “Drop everything! Muster point, now!” I grabbed my hard hat and turned to leave, but then I saw Miguel, the new guy, frozen in place, panic written all over his face. The rules were clear—no stopping, no helping, just get out. But my heart twisted. As a Christian, I’m taught to show kindness, to help those in need, no matter what. I remembered the words of Jesus about loving your neighbor, and I knew Miguel needed someone right now. But the site protocol was strict, and I could already see the others streaming out, not looking back. If I stayed, I’d be breaking the rules, risking my job, maybe even my safety. If I left, I’d be turning my back on someone who needed help. My feet felt rooted to the spot, torn between the demands of my job and the call of my faith, the alarm still blaring in my ears.
